intro: Ipomoea linosepala subsp. auroargentea, commonly known as the silver-leaved morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, waxy leaves that exhibit a striking silver or white variegation. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep orange, typically blooming in the morning. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The species is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, known for its climbing habit and vibrant floral displays.
